definitions.definition: a show of anger, worry, or excitement that is unnecessary or greater than the situation deserves:
examples: She made such a fuss when Richard spilled a drop of wine on her blouse!

definitions.definition: to give someone a lot of attention and treat them well:
examples: She doesn't see her grandchildren very often so she makes a real fuss of them when she does.

definitions.definition: to give too much attention to small matters that are not important, usually in a way that shows that you are worried and not relaxed:
examples: Please, stop fussing - the food's cooking and there's nothing more to do until the guests arrive.
